revised_title: Satellite Doppler Tracking and Geodetic Applications for International Boundary Demarcation
tldr: This article discusses the importance of accurate positioning and geodetic data for international boundaries, particularly in the context of offshore resources. Satellite Doppler tracking is presented as a crucial method for determining position and reconciling different coordinate systems. The example of the Frigg Gas Field in the North Sea demonstrates how the United Kingdom and Norway resolved the geodetic problem of reconciling geodetic and Doppler data to establish an equitable division of the field.
